spanishExample: ¿Alguien vio a Tomás? Iba a venir esta mañana.
englishTranslation: Did anyone see Tomás? He was going to come this morning.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
iba: "was going", "he/she/it was going" (Ir, imperfect, 3rd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
vio: saw, he/she/it saw (Ver, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¿Estás seguro? No vimos tal libro en ese lugar.
englishTranslation: Are you(m) sure? We did not see such a book in that place.
vocabIncluded: seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar
vimos: saw, we saw (Ver, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Por qué estamos viendo este equipo? Son muchos dólares.
englishTranslation: Why are we seeing this equipment? It's a lot of dollars.

spanishExample: ¿Qué tal la comida? Ellos la ven de otra forma.
englishTranslation: How about the food? They look at it in another way.
vocabIncluded: ven: see, they see (Ver, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Solo viniste por el agua o por algo más?
englishTranslation: Did you only come for the water or for something else?
vocabIncluded: "o": "or" when used between items in a list
por used after Ir to mean _pick up_

spanishExample: A ver… tú ves bien y tienes el equipo.
englishTranslation: Let’s see… you see fine and you have the equipment.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
ves: see, you see (Ver, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Algunas amigas son de Perú y, como tal, no les puedes decir eso.
englishTranslation: Some friends(f) are from Peru and, as such, you can’t tell them that.
vocabIncluded: "de" to mean "of" or "from", especially in terms of origin
les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")

spanishExample: Aún hay algo de tiempo para que veamos eso.
englishTranslation: There is still some time for us to see that.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
veamos: see, we see (Ver, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Como tengo tanto tiempo aquí siempre veo eso.
englishTranslation: As I have so much time here, I always see that.
vocabIncluded: veo: see, I see (Ver, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Hola, ¿qué tal? ¿Viste a Sonia?
englishTranslation: Hello, what’s up? Did you see Sonia?
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
viste: saw, you saw (Ver, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Mañana vienen mis amigas y por tal razón será un buen día.
englishTranslation: Tomorrow my friends(f) come and therefore it will be a good day.
vocabIncluded: por tal razón: "for such a reason" (idiom)
será: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Ser, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Marcos tiene dos autos y yo no tengo ninguno.
englishTranslation: Marcos has two cars and I don’t have any.

spanishExample: Mis amigos quieren que vengamos aquí más por el agua.
englishTranslation: My friends want us to come here more for the water.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: No he visto ningún auto en esta parte.
englishTranslation: I haven’t seen any cars in this part.
vocabIncluded: he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No vengas si no hay luz, quiero que veas la mesa.
englishTranslation: Don’t come if there is no light, I want you to see the table.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
veas: see, you see (Ver, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Porque no hay luz no vieron la mesa.
englishTranslation: Because there is no light they didn’t see the table.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
vieron: saw, they saw (Ver, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Siempre vengo aquí, por tal razón tengo una mesa.
englishTranslation: I always come here, therefore I have a table.
vocabIncluded: por tal razón: "for such a reason" (idiom)
vengo: come, I come (Venir, present, 1st person) NEEDS WORK

spanishExample: Tal vez cuando vengas haya algo de comida.
englishTranslation: Perhaps when you come there will be some food.

spanishExample: Tal vez el libro sea sobre eso. Como tal, puede ser bueno.
englishTranslation: Perhaps the book is about that. As such, it might be good.

spanishExample: Tal vez ella venga ya que hay bastantes dólares.
englishTranslation: Perhaps she comes since there are quite a few dollars.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
venga: come, he/she/it come (Venir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
ya que: idiom meaning "since" in a logical sense

spanishExample: Tiene que ser así y, como tal, tienes que hacerlo.
englishTranslation: It has to be this way, and as such, you have to do it.
vocabIncluded: así: adverb meaning "this way", "that way", "like this", "like that"
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Venimos por el libro que está en la mesa.
englishTranslation: We come for the book that is on the table.
vocabIncluded: por used after Ir to mean _pick up_
